text: That mana base seems like it could color screw you pretty easily. As it stands now way too often you're gonna have to choose between playing spells during your turn or keeping the appropriate mana free for counters and instants because plenty often you won't have the right mix for both.

Suggestions for that: IMO 3+ color decks should generally have City of Brass and Mana Confluence. Life is a resource; use it. Ash Barrens is pretty great, too. The Odyssey filters are cheap, and painlands aren't bad either, and all enter untapped. In a multiplayer game it's been my experience that Exotic Orchard is a tri-land way more often than it isn't. Remember that all it takes is someone else with a Vivid land, a City of Brass, etc to have it make every color, and even without those you almost always get two colors you need if not all three just by virtue of the decks being played. I'm guessing you want to keep some ratio of basics to get with Land Tax, etc. but you've still got some room as 20 is a lot for a three color deck.

Unless you have consistent reliable ways to blink it to abuse it I'd much rather get any land I want with an Ex Map or get it into pay for ramp with a Wayfarer's Bauble than I would have a 1/1 chump with Pilgrim's Eye. Matter of personal preference I guess. You do have a Brago and a Panharmonicon and technically you can make it a color with your instants/enchantments to bounce it to hand with Dromar. Even then I think I'd just rather run a Kor Cartographer. That's me though, I tend to value knowing I'm gonna get X over maybe getting X+3 if A, B, C, and D happen simultaneously.

Meta call here, but I've started using Gilded Lotus way less in decks because it gets removed too much. I'd rather have a less bomb rock that stays becuase it flies under the radar than one that people want gone. Things weren't always that way where I play though and it probalby isn't that way in plenty of metas so YMMV there.

It doesn't seem like you're doing an extensive grave recursion, in which case Elixir of Immortality seems kinda meh. Maybe you play in a meta with a ton of mill though in which case it makes sense. 

Top is just overrated and boring unless you can abuse it. So many people just blindly jam it into a deck where it serves as a Halimar Depths once and doesn't do much after that. That said you do have three fetches for shuffling so that might be enough to make it worthwhile. Myself I'd run Scroll Rack instead for Land Tax synergy since  you're running that.

Creatures all make sense.

Not a fan of Arcane Denial, but I'm apparently in the minority since it's one of the most popular spells on edhrec.

You don't have a ton of instant speed draw. I'd rather run a Demonic Tutor and just get anything I want and not lose a draw than save one single mana and be restricted to enchantments/artifacts with Enlightned. There's probalby some decks where the instant speed is maybe worth it, but I'm not seeing it here. That said there is a 20 dollar price difference so if it's there for budget reasons that makes sense.

Ghostway and Eerie interlude would seem good here. You can use them to save stuff from a wipe or procc etb's which alone make them worth it, but if you can kill someone with damage next turn they let you play them in response to Dromar's trigger stopping your stuff from bouncing guarenteeing you've got lethal next time around when everyone else is replaying their field.

I guess Crux of Fate is can save Dromar and maybe Sunscorch Regent, too, but there's plenty of times it lets other dragons go unscathed. I'd wager that the amount of times it winds up being favorable to you isn't that many, partucularly when stacked against Toxic Deluge.

I hate weird uncle tickles

I have a pretty fun story about Winter Orb actually. A friend put it into his Nekusar deck for reasons I couldn't really comprehend. He played a long game against my buddy with a Sharuum artifact recursion deck. The Winter Orb has long since been discarded by Nekusar's wheels. Sharuum guy gets ahead with a big board state and kills the two other players pretty quickly. Nekusar player taps out to destroy everything. Next turn though, Sharuum draws a ton of cards and drops to like 6 life... and plays an Open the Vaults to return all artifacts from all graveyards back to the field. Including the Winter Orb. Nekusar player takes his turn next, but can't untap his lands because of his own Orb. We looked at his hand later and every single card in his hand would have won him the game, from Windfall to Incendiary Command, but he didn't have enough mana because of his own Orb. 

It was promptly removed from the deck after the game.
Ha, that's what you get for playing Orb without untap effects
Orb absolutely owns in brago with tangle wire and the usual suspects.
